newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia spending to continue at current rate-C.Bank.
newsitem.headline: Russia spending to continue at current rate-C.Bank.

text.p: The Russian government will continue spending in line with its actual revenues, even if parliament is unable to take a decision on budget cuts before it starts its summer recess next month, Central Bank Chairman Sergei Dubinin said on Friday.
Asked what would happen if the State Duma lower house had not taken a decision by the time the recess starts late next month, Dubinin told reporters:
"I think the government will finance spending in accordance with the level of its receipts, and in line with budget deficit figures which have already been agreed.
"To my mind there is not a big contradiction between deputies' demands for as many proposals (to increase revenues) as possible and the intentions of the government to increase revenues."
The Duma is currently considering a bill seeking further details of government plans to raise budgeted revenues this year by 30 trillion roubles.
Dubinin said he did not expect the Duma to pass a non-binding bill to double money supply, which it is scheduled to consider later on Friday.
The government has already cut planned spending sharply this year in line with a shortfall in budget revenues, even though it is supposed to seek Duma approval for any spending cuts.
